fields.summary: New Blog Category SEO Page To Be Made Live (Bootstrap version)

content.text: I have some observations that I’d like to share:

The blog page looks visually appealing at first glance, but once we go inside the blog content, the inner template feels outdated and completely different from the Blog Home design. It doesn’t match the new look and feel at all.
After clicking “See More” in the blog section, most of the links shown are just article URLs, which is not at all good.

In the middle “Most Popular” section, I’m not sure what logic is being used to show the blog content. The blog images don’t match with each other. The one shown before and the one shown after look completely different, which feels very mismatched.
Also, instead of naming the top section as “Blog,” it might be better to label it “Recent Blogs” since it’s only showing the latest three posts.
Please let me know your thoughts on this.
Found multiple issues in Menu: (Header) - Pls match with live website’s homepage.
This should not have gone live.

I just reviewed the new blog page and found multiple issues — both in design and functionality — that clearly indicate it wasn’t tested properly. It doesn’t match the Figma file, and several elements are broken or misaligned.
I’ve already spent time identifying issues that should’ve been caught before anything went live.
Developers and QA team — was this even tested?
If yes, how were these issues missed?
We need to fix everything listed before we even consider this final.
Blog page is live now. added menu in dynamic header and footer

fields.summary: Research - Crawl Load from Non-Content Assets (Images, JS, CSS)

content.text: Researched on crawling Non-Content Assets (Images, JS, CSS) and finalized a xls.
Our Google Search Console crawl stats show that
— mostly images, CSS, and JavaScript. This prevents Googlebot from focusing on actual pages like blogs and services.
Google delays crawling or indexing new pages if the crawl budget is wasted on images/scripts
It hurts mobile SEO and Core Web Vitals performance
Makes it harder to qualify for AI Overviews and featured results
for blog, service, articles, website page images, and testimonial images
Helps improve load time and reduces crawl delay
Combine small CSS files where applicable
Minify external + inline styles (via build tools or plugins)
These steps will allow Google to prioritize HTML content over static resources and improve crawl efficiency.

issuetype.description: A small, distinct piece of work.
issuetype.name: Task

fields.summary: Issue - Core Web Vital Issues on Key Pages - VE.com

content.text: I’m sharing a list of important web pages that are currently showing Core Web Vital issues. These need to be prioritized for optimization to ensure compliance with performance standards and maintain overall SEO health.

Please start reviewing these URLs and implement the necessary fixes. Let’s plan to initiate this from Monday. Once you’ve gone through the list, let me know the estimated timelines or if there are any blockers.
